result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian D Brooks was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Controlled Substance [Modifiers: Penalty When None Expressed-Misdemeanor], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine and costs payable as follows:  $75.00 due on or before December 1, 2016 and on the same day each month thereafter, until paid in full.    Failure to pay any part of the fine or court costs in full by the due date will result in 1 day jail for each $25 left unpaid.  $15.00 payment plan fee added.

records.addlTxt: DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Linehan.  Defendant plead guilty to Count 1 and 16TR2691.  Dismiss and read in remaining TR's.  Court recited the charge and possible penalties on the count he plead to.  Defendant understood.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant. Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the plea.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily, knowingly and intelligently entered his plea and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the plea.  Found guilty of Possession of a controlled substance, contrary to 961.41(3g)(b), and Failure to Keep Vehicle Under Control in 16TR2691.  2692 and 2693.  DRI.  State recommended:  fine.  Attorney Linehan recommended $100.00 fine plus costs on 16CM100.   Court ordered the same.  $100.00 fine plus costs.  Pay @ 75/mo starting 12/1.    Failure to pay any part of the fine or court costs in full by the due date will result in 1 day jail for each $25 left unpaid.    Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.  Citation added to payment plan.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 31, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on February 9, 2017 at 09:00 am.
Final pre-trial on January 23, 2017 at 03:00 pm.
STC canceled & scheduled for JT per request of Atty Linehan.

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared through Attorney Ritland for Attorney Linehan.  Waive reading of the complaint.  NGP entered by the court.  PTC 8/17 and STC 9/12 at 3:00 pm.  Bond continued.
from Attorney Linehan.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.
Defendant appeared by video from the Jackson County Jail

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared by video from the Jackson County Jail.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint.  Court recited the charge and possible penalties contained in the complaint.  Defendant understood.  Court advised the defendant to contact SPD for representation.  AIA set for 7/11/16 at 9 am.  $500.00 signature bond set.
Adjourned initial appearance on July 11, 2016 at 09:00 am.
